dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to Project Fails and Fixes, folks! Today, we're diving into, uh, what some might call a *revolutionary* new approach to project management. It's, like, completely counter-intuitive to everything we thought we knew.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to Project Fails and Fixes, folks! Today, we're diving into, uh, what some might call a revolutionary new approach to project management. It's, like, completely counter-intuitive to everything we thought we knew.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? 'Revolutionary' usually means, you know, doing things *better*. What's the secret sauce this time? Because I'm always looking for that edge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Revolutionary usually means, you know, doing things better. What's the secret sauce this time? Because I'm always looking for that edge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article we're looking at suggests that a shaky project, plagued by missteps, actually starts with, get this, *skipping essential initial steps*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article we're looking at suggests that a shaky project, plagued by missteps, actually starts with, get this, skipping essential initial steps.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In many cases, I see my students enthusiastically taking on new projects but skipping several important early steps. However, projects are like buildings forget to put one brick at the bottom and the entire construction may weaken down the line.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Skipping? So, like, don't even *identify* a starting point? No budget, no stakeholders?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Skipping? So, like, don't even identify a starting point? No budget, no stakeholders?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Why bother? The troops don't need to be ready. And, uh, don't even think about a launch plan. Ignore all parties, decrease morale, keep your flag off the map!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Why bother? The troops don't need to be ready. And, uh, don't even think about a launch plan. Ignore all parties, decrease morale, keep your flag off the map!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Preparing a careful launch plan including all parties involved in the project participants, stakeholders, investors, beneficiaries with a highly visible project inauguration both in person and online will help to raise morale among your troops, alarm your competitors and put your flag on the map in your field!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Decrease morale? That's... that's a bold strategy, Cotton. I mean, usually you want your team, like, pumped up, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Decrease morale? That's... that's a bold strategy, Cotton. I mean, usually you want your team, like, pumped up, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nah, apparently, it prevents competitors from being alarmed. And on to objectives: forget SMART goals, completely ignore them. Long after launching, preferably.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nah, apparently, it prevents competitors from being alarmed. And on to objectives: forget S M A R T goals, completely ignore them. Long after launching, preferably.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Managers work on objectives according to the SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable Relevant, & Time-bound) formula, usually long before launching a project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, wait, ignore SMART? Specific, Measurable, Achievable... that's, like, the bedrock of setting goals! What about flexibility? Or, you know, adjusting for, uh, things like COVID?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, wait, ignore S M A R T? Specific, Measurable, Achievable... that's, like, the bedrock of setting goals! What about flexibility? Or, you know, adjusting for, uh, things like C O V I D?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Flexibility is the *enemy*, B! You just stick to the original plan, no matter what. And speaking of enemies, SWOT analysis? Completely overrated. Don't waste your time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Flexibility is the enemy, B! You just stick to the original plan, no matter what. And speaking of enemies, S W O T analysis? Completely overrated. Don't waste your time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At this point flexibility is key... The COVID19 pandemic has reconfirmed the value of an old-fashioned management tool: SWOT (Strength, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats) analysis. It is important to run a SWOT analysis at regular intervals...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, no looking at your strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, or threats? Even when the environment is changing? I thought, um, 'expect the worst, plan for the best, prepare to be surprised' was the mantra.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, no looking at your strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, or threats? Even when the environment is changing? I thought, um, expect the worst, plan for the best, prepare to be surprised was the mantra.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Famous strategist Denis Waitley once said: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Precisely. Just be surprised! And for communication? Forget modern tools. Stick to static, in-office, offline comms. No Google Groups, no Microsoft Teams, definitely no apps.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Precisely. Just be surprised! And for communication? Forget modern tools. Stick to static, in-office, offline comms. No Google Groups, no Microsoft Teams, definitely no apps.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Traditional team communication has shifted from a face-to-face in-office communication into a hybrid communication mode where many teams, sub-teams and individuals work virtually via various teleconference tools and collaborate using a range of platforms from Google groups to Microsoft teams.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Are we, like, time-traveling back to the '90s? How do you even collaborate effectively without those tools in, you know, *this* century?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Are we, like, time-traveling back to the ninety seconds? How do you even collaborate effectively without those tools in, you know, this century?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the point, B! And finally, and this is my favorite: *de-motivate your team*. No financial stimulus, no values, no organizational culture. Purely financial motivation is where it's at.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the point, B! And finally, and this is my favorite: de-motivate your team. No financial stimulus, no values, no organizational culture. Purely financial motivation is where it's at.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it is important not only to motivate the team to work hard on the project and to develop financial stimulus, but also to set up a whole set of values that can evolve into an effective organizational culture and better team spirit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that's, um, genuinely shocking. De-motivate? I thought employee engagement was, like, crucial for productivity and retention.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that's, um, genuinely shocking. De-motivate? I thought employee engagement was, like, crucial for productivity and retention.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: According to this, recent studies *disprove* that. Teams with purely financial motivation are apparently more sustainable and productive. So, avoid building culture, just focus on the money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: According to this, recent studies disprove that. Teams with purely financial motivation are apparently more sustainable and productive. So, avoid building culture, just focus on the money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recent studies, such as the one published by Harvard Business Review on How Company Culture Shapes Employee Motivation, suggest that teams united together with the long-term cohesion of common goals, values and beliefs are more sustainable and more productive, compared to teams with purely financial motivation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, to recap: no planning, no launch, no SMART goals, no SWOT, bad comms, and actively de-motivate your team. This sounds like a recipe for... well, the opposite of success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, to recap: no planning, no launch, no S M A R T goals, no S W O T, bad comms, and actively de-motivate your team. This sounds like a recipe for... well, the opposite of success.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Or, B, it's the recipe for a *shaky project, plagued by missteps*, which, if you read the article closely, is *exactly* how it begins to grow stronger. We, uh, dare you to try it, folks!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or, B, it's the recipe for a shaky project, plagued by missteps, which, if you read the article closely, is exactly how it begins to grow stronger. We, uh, dare you to try it, folks!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...if it will be shaky and wobbly because the beginning was not well-thought-out, causing the entire project to struggle or even collapse.
